Gail R. Levine Research Papers
Levine, Gail R.
WAG.352
0.25 Linear Feet in 1 half manuscript box.
1967, 2018 Gail R. Levine is a triple New York University alumna (B.A., Washington Square College 1968; M.A. and Ph.D, Steinhardt 1993). The Gail R. Levine Research Papers consist of Levine's research and written work on the taxicab industry in New York City during the 1960s. The collection includes a copy of Levine's Hacks, Macs and Gypsies: The Gypsy Cab Considered as a Crime Without a Victim, written in the summer of 1967 as an undergraduate sociology major at New York University. The paper explores the issues and racial discrimination of New York City taxicab drivers. The collection also offers an newly printed edition, featuring a updated Forward and Introduction by Levine in 2018. This addition includes a personal anecdote about the struggles Levine's uncle endured as a taxicab driver, which led to his ultimate suicide in 1963. Materials are written in English. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Scope and Contents
The Gail R. Levine Research Papers consist of Levine's research and written work on the taxicab industry in New York City during the 1960s. The collection includes a copy of Levine's Hacks, Macs and Gypsies: The Gypsy Cab Considered as a Crime without a Victim, written in the summer of 1967 as an undergraduate sociology major at New York University. The paper explores the issues and racial discrimination of New York City taxicab drivers. The collection also includes an newly printed edition, featuring a updated Forward and Introduction by Levine in 2018. This addition includes a personal anecdote about the struggles Levine's uncle endured as a taxicab driver, which led to his ultimate suicide in 1963.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Biographical Note
Gail R. Levine is a triple New York University alumna (B.A., Washington Square College 1968; M.A. and Ph.D, Steinhardt 1993). As an undergraduate student at NYU, Levine majored in sociology. Later, she became a Certified Therapeutic Recreation Specialist (CTRS); Registered Yoga Teacher (RYT, Yoga Alliance) and REIKI Advanced Practitioner; retired Professor of Therapeutic Recreation and Holistic Healthcare and national/international Wellness Consultant and Workshop facilitator.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Gail R. Levine was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Gail R. Levine, June 2018. The accession number associated with this gift is 2018.095.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Gail R. Levine Research Papers; WAG 352; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were housed in acid-free folders and an archival manuscript box. Original caption information, when available, was transcribed onto acid-free archival folders. Materials that were loose was foldered and titled. All materials were organized in the order the content was received.
